page.title: 18ROADS-PAST, PRESENT, FUTURE
page.content: The road system of the area has changed very little over the years.The basic framework was set down many hundreds of years ago. Predominantly rural in aspect, the road system developed, linking the small villages of Catherine-de-Barnes, Hampton in Arden, Eastcote and the scattered farms with Solihull. As Solihull grew, the residential area to the west developed it's road system, while others changed little. Lugtrout Lane, Henwood Lane , Friday Lane have remained tree and hedge lined with grass and ditch verges. The M42 which cuts the area north to south, the A41 dual carriageway and the Damson Parkway have made the most impact in recent years. They have linked the area to the International Airport and the National Exhibition Centre.
